r = 0 is misunderstood to be the final coordinate for a gravitational collapsing mass.
It is not.
r = 0 is the point of origin of length contraction.

As gravitational length contraction contracts inwardly, external pressure increasing the density of mass contracts spacetime outwardly. This results in r = 0 being equivalent to the Schwarzschild radius once the Schwarzschild radius is reached. This is, of course, an impossibility, no less impossible than accelerating mass to luminal velocity.

Gravitation cannot increase the density of mass. Only external pressure can compact a mass which in turn curves spacetime thereby increasing the gravitation. Spacetime cannot curve itself to make the mass curving it more dense. That would be perpetual motion.

The test for whether or not an object is a black hole is gravitational waves.
Gravitational waves propagate at luminal velocity from the edge of a volume of mass.
Nothing at luminal velocity can propagate away from a Schwarzschild radius.
Black holes cannot have gravitational waves.

Whether it be the Lorentz factor or the Uncertainty Principle & Zero Point Energy, mass cannot be compacted to a state in which the velocity of causality and the motion of quantum particles can be suspended. It would require an infinite amount of energy/mass to achieve.

No one has considered the possibility of claimed black holes being gluon stars. When black holes were first presented as existing around 1965, nothing had been known of gluons in the general physicist community as chromodynamics had only just been revealed. Thus, matter degeneracy beyond a neutron star was never considered and the degeneracy of a quark-gluon plasma is only a matter of speculation. One simply cannot jump from neutron stars to saying that black holes must next exist while not being able to show any possibility of a quark-gluon plasma collapsing and then a pure gluon phenomenon collapsing.

Furthermore, 0 + 0 does not = > 0. An object of infinite density and 0 volume cannot combine with another object of infinite density and 0 volume to result in an even larger object. The fact that objects being called black holes are of different sizes proves that their mass is not of 0 volume but instead adds together to create larger objects that obviously aren't being infinitely compacted.

Not quite. Basic General Relativity will tell you that from the perspective of an outside observer, it takes an object falling into a BH an infinitely long time to reach the event horizon. That means it would also have taken an infinitely long time for all the mass to have gotten inside in the first place. A BH, or more specifically a singularity of macroscopic mass, is a state that a collapsing star approaches asymptotically without ever quite reaching. That's why astrophysicists leave themselves some wiggle room with the words "...or BH-like objects."

Replace the term 'black hole' with 'tooth fairy' to see how much sense this all really makes. The fact of the matter is, objects heavier than a neutron star are identified as being black holes simply because they're heavier than neutron stars. The fact that gravitational waves are produced from the edge of a volume of mass and that objects said to be black holes have produced gravitational waves proves that they're not black holes as a gravitational wave, just like light, would never be able to escape the event horizon that lies outside of the edge of mass of a black hole. Physical principles such as the Uncertainty principle that reveals that a particle must have infinite momentum to have 0 motion and the Lorentz factors that require infinite energy/mass to obtain 0 time dilation prove that black holes can never come into existence. Where there is 0 time at the event horizon, there must also be 0 length and therefore a two-dimensional object of no depth that cannot exist in the universe. The only reason black holes are said to exist is because of John Wheeler stating that no force was known that could prevent the total gravitational collapse of mass beyond that of a neutron star. Not identifying a preventive force is not sufficient grounds for declaring an object to exist especially when the preventive factors from both quantum mechanics (Uncertainty principle) and relativity (Lorentz factors) had already been known and have never been addressed in how they can be ignored to allow a black hole to exist. Even the concept of falling through an event horizon is based upon the concept of a black hole being a gravitational singularity which only comes about through changing the coordinate system of space to get such a result. The Schwarzschild coordinate system that is in accordance with general relativity shows that there is no space beyond the Schwarzschild radius to fall into. This, in itself, agrees with the Lorentz factor of length contraction that must be 0 at the Schwarzschild radius. Thus, general relativity has never predicted the existence of black holes as is often falsely claimed. Relativity in fact prohibits the existence of such objects. Massive objects heavier than neutron stars are just that, super massive objects. Currently not knowing what they are no more makes them black holes than it makes them tooth fairies, especially when we already know the principles of physics that prevent them from being black holes.
